page.topic: Previewing a Report, Label, or Letter
page.description: To preview a report, label, or letter.

step.description: Display the appropriate tab of the Control Panel.
Select the layout of interest and click Preview > Preview.

case.description: If the preview is more than one page, use these buttons to scroll through it. You may also enter a page number and click ENTER to go directly to that page.
Zooms in and out of the preview.
Toggles between a one page and a two page preview of the layout.
Toggles between a color and a black/white preview of the layout.
Displays the Save As dialog box to select different formats for saving the current preview as a file. These options are: HTML, Text, RTF, and PDF.
Displays the Send As dialog box to select different formats for emailing the current preview. These options are: HTML, Text, RTF, and PDF.

step.description: Make a selection from the Save as list. The options are:

case.description: "Adobe Acrobat PDF File". Can be displayed with Adobe Acrobat Reader.
"Dynamic HTML File". Can be displayed with a browser.
"Rich Text Format File". Can be displayed with Microsoft Word or Microsoft Wordpad.
"Plain Text File". Can be displayed with Microsoft Notepad and many other text editors.

step.description: Optionally, un-check Open file with associated application if you do not want to see the results.
Enter the name of the file you are going to create in the Filename field.
Click Options to display the Options dialog to control more formatting and processing steps.
Make a selection from the Select a File Type list. The options are:
Click Options to choose the email client you want to use.
If you selected "Adobe Acrobat PDF File", click Click to Set PDF Options to display the Options dialog to control more formatting and processing steps.
If you selected "Dynamic HTML File", click Click to Set HTML Options to display the Options dialog to control more formatting and processing steps.
If you selected "Rich Text File", click Click to Set RTF Options to display the Options dialog to control more formatting and processing steps.
